identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a 'Digital Pass' aesthetic that feels like a high-end kitchen control room‚Äîprecise, dark, and electric.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix 'Bloomberg Terminal' density with 'Michelin Star' elegance.
Emotion First: The user is the Chef de Cuisine. The UI gives them control.
Content is King: The Menu Item is the hero. Pricing is the plot.
Zoom In: Macro photography of food textures vs. micro-typography of costs.
Negative Space: Use it to separate the 'Noise' (competitors) from the 'Signal' (profit).

heading.usage: Page titles, Section headers, Marketing slogans

body.usage: General UI text, descriptions, form labels

mono.usage: Prices, Ingredient costs, IDs, Code snippets

strategies.dashboard_mode: The Control Room: Dense, high-contrast, 100% width utilization.
strategies.marketing_mode: The Tetris Grid: Asymmetrical, generous whitespace, overlapping elements.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 h-10 px-6 rounded-md font-medium transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.secondary: bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground hover:bg-secondary/80 h-10 px-6 rounded-md font-medium transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.ghost: hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground h-10 px-4 rounded-md transition-colors
buttons.outline: border border-input bg-background hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground h-10 px-6 rounded-md transition-colors

cards.default: bg-card text-card-foreground rounded-xl border border-border shadow-sm

inputs.default: flex h-10 w-full rounded-md border border-input bg-background px-3 py-2 text-sm ring-offset-background file:border-0 file:bg-transparent file:text-sm file:font-medium placeholder:text-muted-foreground focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50

visual_enhancers.textures: bg-[url('https://grainy-gradients.vercel.app/noise.svg')] opacity-20 mix-blend-overlay pointer-events-none fixed inset-0 z-50

hero.alt: Chef plating food on dark background

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Dark Mode' by default. Ensure 'class' strategy in Tailwind config.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'JetBrains Mono' for all pricing/numerical data.
For the Menu Upload section, create a large, dashed-border drop zone that feels like a 'blueprint' area.
In the Dashboard, use the 'Control Room' grid strategy: dense, no wasted space, high contrast for metrics.
Use the provided image URLs for the landing page and sample data.
Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid' attributes.
Do not use gradients for backgrounds; use solid dark colors with subtle borders.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ü§ñüß†üí≠üí°üîÆüéØüìöüé≠üé¨üé™üéâüéäüéÅüéÄüéÇüç∞üéàüé®üé∞üí∞üíµüí≥üè¶üíéü™ôüí∏ü§ëüìäüìàüìâüíπüî¢üèÜü•á etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories (especially sponsor logos) = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
Create new components that match the style and conventions of existing components when needed.
Examine existing components to understand the project's component patterns before creating new ones.
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...).
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...}).
Use 'sonner' for toasts. Sonner component are located in '/app/src/components/ui/sonner.tsx'.
